text: Nödinge Church () is a church building in Nödinge-Nol in Västergötland in Sweden. It is located north of the town of Gothenburg. The current church was built in 1727 when it replaced an older Romanesque church from the 1100s or 1200s. The church has a baroque interior. Its ceiling has paintings by painter Alexander Fox from 1734. The pulpit was added in 1741 by sculptor Johan Petter Weber. The church underwent renovation in 1981-1982. The church was also used during recording of the 2013 film 'The Anderssons Hit the Road. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:Church of Sweden churches Category:1727 establishments Category:18th-century buildings and structures Category:1720s establishments in Europe
title: Nödinge Church
